column4: hi, i think my graphics card driver in ubuntu is messed up - after a while, i can't read any of the text on the screen.  how do i fix this?
i'm not sure, how can i find that out?
00:02.0 VGA compatible controller: Intel Corporation 82945G/GZ Integrated Graphics Controller (rev 02)
ok  now you know which graphics card you have :)
do you have the large launcher on the left side of the screen?
ok  see if you have  compizconfig-settings-manager installed
i don't have it, should i go ahead and install it?
so would just installing solve the problem?
no a setting may have to be made in ccsm
so when that installs,, in terminal again type    ccsm for it to open

then you will see on the left,, a vertical list of the categories.. you want to click on the "General" category.. then click on  "OpenGL" to bet into its settings,, once there,  uncheck both "Lighting"  and "Sync to VBLank"  and then test if the same problem still occurs
unfortunately I have to go to work so I will let the other help you with t his from this point
